Package com.tradingCardInventory.controllers

Class MenuController

java.lang.Object
com.tradingCardInventory.controllers.MenuController
public class MenuController extends Object
The MenuController class serves as the central controller for the application, coordinating the initialization and interaction of all major modules: Collection, Binders, and Decks. It sets up the GUI navigation and loads the appropriate views using the MainView interface.

This controller acts as the entry point of the application and handles switching between the start menu and the main menu, as well as delegating control to individual module controllers like CollectionController, BindersController, and DeckController.

Follows the MVC architecture.

    Loads the main menu navigation bar and center panel, allowing users to choose between managing the collection, binders, or decks.
    void
    run()
    Launches the application window and sets up the start menu, including button listeners for "Start" and "Exit".

    • MenuController

      public MenuController()
      Constructs the MenuController and initializes all major system components.

      Pre-condition: - Supporting classes like Collection, ManageBinders, etc., must be defined.

      Post-condition: - All modules are initialized and ready to be run via run().

  • Method Details

      public void run()
      Launches the application window and sets up the start menu, including button listeners for "Start" and "Exit".

      Loads the main menu navigation bar and center panel, allowing users to choose between managing the collection, binders, or decks.
